  • Changelog

Compute the likelihood.

Source: R/getLikelihood.R
getLikelihood.Rd

This function computes the likelihood associated to a specific set of parameters. The specification of parameters determines the ecological processes involved.

getLikelihood(pars, obs, zero_infl = FALSE, neigh = NULL,
  disp = NULL, favo = NULL, SDBH = NULL, kernel = "kern_lognormal",
  pstr = NA, ppz = NA, pscal = NA, pshap = NA, pfav = NA,
  pneigh = NA, quiet = TRUE, record = NULL)

Arguments

pars

vector of parameters values, the size must
obs

vector of observations of recruitement for each plots of the stand.
zero_infl

logical. If TRUE then a zero-inflated poisson distribution is used, otherwose a poisson distribution is used.
neigh

a logical. If NULL (the default setting) the is TRUE then neighborhood
disp

a logical. If NULL (the default setting) the is TRUE then neighborhood
favo

a logical. If NULL (the default setting) the is TRUE then neighborhood
SDBH

a numeric vector of standarized DBH (Diameter at breast heights).
kernel

a character string indicating which kernel should be used (either kern_lognormal or kern_exponential_power). See kernels for further details.
pstr

position of paraneter in thevector of parameter values.
ppz

the position of pz parameter within the vector of parameter values.
pscal

An integer gving the position of the scale parameter (of the dispersal kernel) witin the vector of parameter values.
pshap

An integer gving the position of the shape parameter (of the dispersal kernel) witin the vector of parameter values.
pfav

A vector of integer indicating the position of the five favorability values within the vector of parameter values.
pneigh

position of the parameter associated to the neighborhood effect in the vector of parameter values.
quiet

logial. If FALSE then parameters and likelyhood estimations are printed.
record

a connection, or a character string naming the file to print to. If NULL, the default values, no record is done.

Value

The log-likelihood values associated to a given set of parameters.

Details

The parameter pz have a value even if it is not included in the analysis (meaning a poisson distrubution is used).

Contents
